articles.title: Rugby-Online abuse of Curry unacceptable, says Farrell
articles.description: World Rugby and South Africa Rugby have both been investigating the accusation but have yet to make any announcement about possible punishment, which could include a ban that would rule Mbonambi out of Saturday's final against New Zealand. "What isn't understandable is the amount of abuse he's got," Farrell said in press conference ahead of Friday's bronze final against Argentina.
articles.content:
England flanker Tom Curry has been on the receiving end of relentless online abuse this week and captain Owen Farrell, usually a player who says the minimum in his media dealings, took to the microphone on Wednesday to say it was unacceptable.
During... [3220 chars]

articles.title: Rugby-New look for England as Arundell, Steward and Smith start v Argentina
articles.description: Jamie George, Bevan Rodd, Dan Cole, David Ribbans, Lewis Ludlam, Danny Care, George Ford and Ollie Lawrence are on the bench. Curry has been at the centre of an off-field storm this week after he accused South African hooker Bongi Mbonambi of racially abusing him in the semi-final.
articles.content: Henry Arundell and Freddie Steward will start on the wing for England in the bronze final against Argentina on Friday, with Marcus Smith returning at fullback as coach Steve Borthwick made eight changes from the team beaten by South Africa in the sem... [3532 chars]

articles.title: Argentina v England: Ben Youngs to retire from Test rugby after World Cup third-place play-off
articles.description: Ben Youngs, England's most capped men's player, will end his international career after the World Cup third-place play-off against Argentina on Friday.
articles.content:

Youngs made his senior England debut as a substitute against Scotland in March 2010
